Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but a little tired”
Reviews.Author: Joy R
Reviews.Content: Fabulous position in San Marco, albeit somewhat noisy. The rooms are due for an update, every time I went to the loo, I would push the appropriate flush mechanism, it fell on the floor. Cleaning clearly not their forte but nonetheless a great time had.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice to Explore Venice”
Reviews.Author: Ucko
Reviews.Content: Considering when once in Venice, best is to be outside and walk around, the most reasonable choice for a hotel is not the decoration, nor the ambiance but the location and this hotel's best offer is exactly that: great location. It's only 1 or 2 minutes away from the San Marco Place yet, the noise of San Marco can not reach the hotel. The first impression when you enter is not very promising: the reception area is very small, the recepsionists are very busy, so you have to wait to be served but the rooms, though not as spacious as modern hotels are, are very characteristic, nicely decorated, clean and confortable. Rooms with canal view are the best. Hotel has a lobby looking into the canal but it's empty almost all the time. In case you plan to use the hotel just to sleep and as a common point to commute into the city, this hotel is the right choice.

Reviews.Title: “If this hotel thinks it is 4 stars, it is dreaming...”
Reviews.Author: davidojs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week for Easter. Was genuinely disappointed with this property. Staff was OK at best, friendly, but didn't want to even remotely go out of their way to help you. Beds were stiff as a board. Sleeping on the floor would have been better. The worst part was the unbelievable noise. It was almost impossible to sleep at night. Most rooms overlook a gondola staging area and a Hard Rock Cafe. At 5AM you hear the gondolas coming out, at 11PM you hear the party in the Hard Rock. Terrible! Only saving grace for this hotel was the good proximity to Piazza San Marco

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and great experience in Venice”
Reviews.Author: DuncanYorkshire
Reviews.Content: I was attracted to this hotel as it overlooked the Gondola meeting place. I e mailed the hotel before we arrived to ask if they could put us in a room which overlooks this view. My request was met and we had the most wonderful view. The hotel room was quite small but we didn't intend to spend a lot of time in it as we would be exploring Venice. The bathroom was lovely and clean and the hotel staff were really friendly and helpful. The breakfast was great, with cold meats, cheese, lovley bacon and omelettes in addition to loads of fresh fruit and different types of bread, croissants etc. I think all of the hotels in Venice are guaranteed business so may not appear as a 4 star that you would expect in another country, but from my experience, Rome is the same. Overall we have had a brilliant three days and I would recommend this hotel - the location is brilliant, literally just under the arches from St Marks' sqaure and you are there.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, Truly a Venice Experience”
Reviews.Author: SL D
Reviews.Content: I stayed the week before, Carnivale and had a Fantastic time. Location, location , location. One minute and one bridge away from San Marco Square, right on the water! I paid the little extra for a view of the water and gondolas which was charming and fun. The room was clean and comfortable, the bath the same. The front desk was helpful and polite. They arranged for some of us to take a launch over to Murano gratis, but be aware you are on your own to take the water taxis back. I loved the area, with all the eateries and shopping, the streets were fabulous to walk at all hours of the day and night. Incredible value.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, hotel is nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Raymart
Reviews.Content: Don't have high expectations of the hotels in Venice. I give this one a 6 for the location. Nothing else special. Wifi didn't work. Old hotel needs renovation. However that is the situation for most Venice hotels. The city is amazing and worth the shady hotels! Location is amazing at this hotel. 1 minute walking to Saint Marks Square. Try to push for a room in the hotel with view as opposed to the standby hotel they use on the other side of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but otherwise disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Chris T
Reviews.Content: As most of the reviews have already stated, this hotel has a great location - just yards away from St Mark's Square. However, that is where the rave review ends. The hotel seems to be split in two with one half overlooking the canal and Hard Rock Cafe and the shabbier half overlooking a noisy ally. We were in the latter which was accessed by going up two flights of stairs, walking over the bridge and then back down some stairs to our room. The room itself looked somewhat tired but was adequate as a crash pad and we were stuck with twin beds as the website we booked through kept throwing up a glitch when we tried to book a double. Breakfast was disappointing compared to the one we had enjoyed at a sister Best Western hotel in Milan earlier that week and I would suggest that a trip to the local bakeries etc would be a better and cheaper option. At about ten pm on our second night all of the power in our room went off. I rang reception and was assured that they would send someone to our room to take a look. Obviously no one arrived. A quick look out of the door told me that all the power on our side of the hotel was out and then the banging and shouting started as they tried in vain to fix it. By midnight we had given up hope of being told anything or offered a different room and went to bed. The power was still off when we woke up. I went to reception to ask what was happening and the receptionist just rudely told me that it would be fixed in an hour. I asked for a torch so hat could get ready but a communication problem resulted in him giving me a key to a room to use to get ready. Rather than drag all our stuff to the other side of the hotel we decided to wait an hour and have a lazy lie in. Ninety minutes later there was still o power so we decided to use the torch on my phone to light up the bathroom, but now there was no water pressure so we were forced to go and find the other room. We finally left the hotel at about eleven am and were again curtly informed that the electricity would be on in an hour. We returned that evening and the power was back but there was still very little water pressure. We checked out the following morning and informed them about the water. I was amazed when he responded by saying that we were not the first people to mention it. There was no apology about either the water or the electricity and there was certainly no offer of any form of recompense.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Susane-Maria
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel with a superb location, close to Piazza San Marc. if you have a room with the view to the canal and the gondolas,you are on the right place, but if the view is towards somebody else's window then you are up to a lots of aggravationâ€¦The room I was offered at the begging was just like that ( close look at the next building's window). I categorically tried to explain, that I specifically requested a canal view room and after a long discussion about who said what, I was given a room with the view to the canal and Hard Rock Caffe. The receptionist were trying to inform me that canal view room is at extra charge, but since there was not such an information mentioned on their web site (the fact I was desperately tried to point out) they've let me have the room I originally requestedâ€¦I 've also specified that I prefer a carpeted room, (which was a choice on the site), carpeted or wooden floor (I' ve chosen carpeted). Their idea of carpeted floor was a small rug in front of the bed, so I still don't understand why listing those choices when there's no carpeted room in the entire hotel.At list I didn't see one.I saw several rooms (all carpeted, according to them) and all of them had stained old rug, in front of the bed, with colours that had faded long agoâ€¦ Since Venice is a magnificent city, there's no time to look out for the hotel's misleading descriptions on their web site but I did have enough time to enjoy the city and also not so much enjoy the hotel.The idea of the excellent service is when you pay them first and after deal with what you are given and don't ask for moreâ€¦ The hotel does not have a proper lobby, There are several chairs chaotically arranged for whomever passing by to make a short stop. And the bar is a small counter with a very limited selection.The prices you are paying to eat and drink are shocking. The decor in the room is traditional, venetian, but very tired and worn outâ€¦no standard of 4* hotel whatsoever. On one occasion I ve asked the maid to help me switch the post lamp in the room and she said that it has been like that for a long time, the post lamp was actually statue of a woman who was holding a chandelier, and according to the maid it was only for a decoration, but of no use at all. Why would you have a giant post lamp in the corner of the room that does not function? The towels in the bathroom were devided to a 2 bath towels and two face towelsâ€¦the face towels weren't the type of towels that everyone should think they would be, but they were towels like a serviettes ( the ones that you see in the restaurants when you have your meal). that type of fabric the face towels were made from. Perhaps it's not a big deal, I just wanted to mention it because in my experience of excessive traveling still haven't seen a face towel that resembles the tea towel. Don't even think about helping yourself with the mini bar in the room. The coca cola in the can is 4 euros.The two bedside night lamps were working on and off and by that I mean after you switch the light on they were on and off all the timeâ€¦and when you realise there's no point to have them on ( they are only distraction) the common thing to do is switching them off completelyâ€¦ In overall apart from the view and the location this hotel should never be declared as a four star. Barely 3* The receptionists were trying hard in their own way, but always made sure first they were "calculating the euros" before they provided a good service. Everything is extra. And they made sure, you know it. I would recommend this hotel to a travellers who are passing by or stay over the night,.. for a longer holiday it is not a place to beâ€¦spacially is not suitable for children. No entertaiment on the TV either. only MTV and CNN, everything else is on Italianâ€¦And it doesn't appeal to me when George Cloony and Bred Pit are speaking Italianâ€¦a city like that where everyone is tourist should have a variety of TV channels, specially in the 4* hotels...

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get a better location if you tried...wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: 647CharlotteF647
Reviews.Content: My partner and I and his friends (who are a couple) stayed here on the 1st March til 4th March 2012, having pre-booked and pre-paid from England using the 'San Marco Hotels' group website I was a little scared it wasn't going to meet my very high expectations! It certainly met them! Location is absolutely fantastic, literally a stones throw away from St Marks Square and about a ten minute walk to the Rialto bridge. Rooms were lovely venetian style decor and clean, the rooms were serviced every day at your convenience (one morning we didn't rise til after 12 due to the night before and the maids waited for us to be up and leave before they made the bed changed the towels etc, which isn't always the case!) I didn't eat at the hotel but my fellow travellers assured me that breakfast was fantastic and worth the 15euro price tag. If you can, take a glass of wine out to the jetty where the gondolas are and spend a few hours watching the world go by! Word of warning though the alcohol in the hotel is very expensive, we paid 27euro for two bottles of becks and a glass of wine. Very friendly and accomodating staff, amazing location wonderful hotel and a fantastic experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CKE80Y
Reviews.Content: the hotel is just off the san Marco square and easy to find from the Airport Ferry. The ferry takes a little over an hour and is 15e or 25e return/person. The taxis are 110e for one way. We saved the money but a taxi one way would have been good. Just walk to left hand corner of saint marco square (facing away from water) and there is a small side street - the hotel is 10 meters over a small bridge. We had 1st floor room with gondolas outside. With roller shutters down and curtains closed the noise was very low. We slept till 10.30 first morning. The room was small but comfortable. The bathroom was too small for 2 people at once. The shower was over a bath and so narrow you had to stand sideways to wash. (No good for elderly or impaired). Having said that the facilities were typical best western. Staff were great. Tip - have breakfast at the hotel 15e each- and load up energy for the day. This is a cheap option as food is expensive in venice (although good).

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB VACATION”
Reviews.Author: 1Desmond
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had enjoyed this hotel immensely many years ago--arriving by gondola at the Cavalletto e Doge hotel's Orseolo water landing from the car park. I returned for a ten day vacaction in January 2012. I savoured the gorgeous views of the gondola basin. The room was classically elegant with traditional Venetian furnishings, a lovely Murano ceiling chandelier, a Blackamoor mounted floor based chandelier, marble bathroom, courteous and friendly front desk, fastidious house-keeping, satisfying breakfast. All in All an elegantly stimulating vacation experience and I whole-heartedly recommend this historical hotel and its superb ambience and location in the heart of Venice. I plan to happily return and to stay again. Overall a gratifying and scintillating experience. It was extraordinarily pleasurable!

Reviews.Title: “Great Venice pre or post cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kristine G
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, location and breakfast included! Found this hotel when booking with travel points on line and loved it! Right next to Piazza St. Marco (St. Marks Square) and excellent for taking short walks all over. The rooms are basic and clean, washrooms excellent and the staff very friendly. From the breakfast area, you could open a patio door and see the gondolas floating past - awesome! My husband and I were there for 2 nights before our Princess Cruise of the Med. Were not sure what to expect but loved it and would stay there again for sure - if I can book with points because it's pricey. If you have the cash, splurge because it's worth the location for sure!

Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: Roisin S
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a 5 night break in the Hotel mid November last and had a great time there. The room was basic but delightfully warm with hot water as needed. Staff could not do enough to help and responded immediately to any request including printing some emails for me! We had breakfast included and it was delicious with a choice of fruit, deli meats, cheeses, cereals, breads, rolls and toast, yogurt, omelettes and bacon. Plenty of coffee and tea, water and orange juice. Breakfast included a wonderful view of the main Gondola point. It was quiet and serene. A stones throw from St Marks Square and just next to the Hard Rock Cafe. I would stay here again should I ever return to Venice. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: fruitandnutcake
Reviews.Content: We found this Best Western while booking our (very) last minute New Year's getaway. The rate was fairly reasonable compared to all the other hotels available at the time. I was a bit apprehensive having read the scathing reviews on Tripadvisor, but felt compelled to write my own to add some balance, having felt the older reviews I read to be somewhat unfair. First, great location, right next to the Piazza San Marco. As such, I'd recommend a rear-facing room if street noise is a big factor. Very easy to get to once you've arrived by boat, and after a long day of walking around all the winding alleys. Second, I found the staff to be friendly and attentive -- not a sniff of contempt or aggression whatsoever. (Perhaps they've had some turnover since the last reviews?) Third, the room we stayed in was definitely "bijou"; the reader photos on Tripadvisor don't lie. This wasn't an issue for us. Perfectly adequate for a short city break, clean and with all amenities you'd expect. In short, if you can get yourself a deal here, like we did via hotels.com, then it's a safe bet for your stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Finn T
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Best Western Cavalletto E Doge Orseolo hotel between Christmas and New Year 2011. A friend of mine did the booking. I should have studied Trip advisor and would have found another hotel. The hotel did not live up to my expectations. It was very nicely located near San Marco, which we were happy for, but I do not think it is crucial to stay near San Marco. Venice is a small place and San Marco can be easily reached from most parts of Venice. The room was small, too small for two adults! The bathroom was fine and clean which is always important. The hotel advertises with Internet, but the connection in the room where we stayed was poor and cumbersome. Breakfast is 15 Euro per person, but not worth it! We managed our self well and without the reception that seamed tired of tourists! Venice is a fantastic city we had five marvelous days.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service poor”
Reviews.Author: ClairDb
Reviews.Content: Staff did not or care what they were doing! Dated rooms! Breakfast Couldn't fault or location.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Place like the Plague”
Reviews.Author: CarrollTHarriss
Reviews.Content: Anyone who has a good thing to say about this hotel either has no clue or was put up to it by the management. If the service were something better than aggressive and contemptuous, I would not mind so much about it being a dank, nasty hole of a place. Of course it is laughably overpriced and inclined to outright price-gouging during major events, but even if they were paying guests to stay there, it would be an unpleasant place.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice.”
Reviews.Author: MidwestTripGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in this hotel. Thought I was splurging since I used 36,000 Best Western points per night and paid $300 for the second night. I did not have hot water until the last night, was unable to find a way to call to the front desk and the bed and pillow were so old and hard I was unable to sleep. The walls were very thin and I actually heard guests in the next room passing gas. The location is very goodI travel internationally and am not a picky traveler but when you spend this much and expect a 4 Star, it just makes you mad. The location is good but not an easy walk from the vaparetto as you still need to haul luggage up and over a bridge. On departure I was unable to get through St. Mark's square to the vaparetto stop as well and had to haul my luggage across to Rialto anyway. The water was too high in October when I stayed to get a water taxi to the hotel despite the "private dock" they advertise. This dock offers access to overpriced gondola rides. I asked at the hotel desk and they quoted me 125 euros for a gondola ride. I walked over to Rialto and got one from the Grand Canal for 80 euros. The front desk people clearly did not like their jobs and barely tolerated tourists. I filed a complaint with Best Western (first time ever making a formal complaint about a hotel!) and received a lame email from the hotel management "Sorry you were disappointed. We hope you will stay with us again." Not a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly bad value, hostel rather than a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Louise R
Reviews.Content: The hotel featured on the website bears no resemblance to the hotel. It is barely a 2 star hotel - the room was tiny with paper thin walls, it smelt dank and the furniture was very old. Little or no comfort. For the price, this hotel is incredibly poor value. Really the only positive was the location but it was not the sort of hotel you could relax in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Marina_ua
Reviews.Content: I was in Venice 10-14 September and stayed 4 nights in Cavaletto, took double standard room. I have to say- I am very very satisfied with my choice. Really suprised, why so much negative comments on this hotel. 1. The location is perfect! Literally 2 steps from Piazza San Marco. The people, who travel to Venice frist time have to take into account the fact, that it is very easy to get lost in Venice, a lot of small streets, and it is very hard to find the right building. I was told in one cafe that only the postman in Venice is able to find always the right adress. But there are a lot of sign with directions to San Marco Square, so it is always very easy to find the hotel.Also the stop of ferry boat is only 5 min walk from hotel 2. The room was very clean, In very nice old venetian style. In room you can find hairdryer, tv, telephone, safe for keeping documents and money, towels and small shampoos in bathroom.The bathroom was very clean. My hairdryer in room did not work, I asked to reception to change it and in 5 min my problem was solved- they brought me new hair dryer in the room.The cleaning was made everyday.As I took double standard room, i had no view from the window(it was actually the view on neigbour hotel roofs), but it was ok, because when you are in Venice- you use room only for rest and sleep.The people at the reception were always very polite and helpful. 3. The breakfast was very good, continental, cheese, ham, toasts, eggs, some bakery, yoghurts, and fresh fruits!I enjoyes pinaples and watermelons a lot. Very nice coffee. Yes, the hotel is not cheap, i payed 270 euro per night, but i am satisfied with it. Mostly you pay for great location.The Venice by itself is expensive, but it is justified- it is not financial center, it is the museum, it is like city without future, but I really believe the world will save Venice. I remember my days in Venice as the best moments of my life. It is really unique city.When you travel to Venice not the first time, you can choose hotel also in other location that is not so expensive, but you have to know the city. There is some tips for your staying in venice: 1. Surely take gondola ride!! yes, it is expensive, 100 euro per 30-40 min ride, but it is really unique experince. There are some things, that are more valuable than money...I believe smart people understand what i am talking about. I am only 28 years old, but I was really suprised when I met there some old couples( from USA), and on my question did they make gondola ride, I heard the answer-"No way, it is too expensive!". I know, we all different cultures and have different values, but Venice without gondola ride is not Venice, and it is expensive city, and with this price we support city and people who live in it and give to us this incredible atmosphere. 2. Again, I want to repeat, if you are first time in Venice- try to take hotel near San Marco Square, Cavaletto is perfect for that, if the price sounds ok for you. But again, I want to mention, that dont try to save money in Venice, it is unique city, and if the life gave you chance to visit it- try to feel it fully. 3. When you coming from airport to venice,take the water taxi from Piazza Le Roma, not ferry boat, taxi will bring you right to your hotel(if it is possible). It is really incredible experience, I felt myself like a princess in that moment:) (my mother was in Venice few years ago and had the same feeling from water taxi). 4. In the evening, try real venetian drinks Bellini or SpritzAperol in the cafe with tables right on Piazza San Marco, where they have live orchestra.It is also incredible show, the small candle lights of square make you feel life you are in huge living room with a lot of guests! 5.Go to Burano(dont mix with Murano) island! Very very nice and bright island with colourful houses and small really italian cozy yards! and I highly reccomend to you to stop for lunch there in the restaurant called Gatto Nero(Black Cat). Incredible cuisine!I never tried so tasty seafood in my life:)The atmosphere is really italian. 6. Visit Palazzo Ducalle, Basilico San Marco, Bienalle. And the last tip- relax, forget all the negative problems-leave all that at home, open your mind and heart to Venice, for receiving incredible emotions, for receiving something beautiful in your life.And then Venice will open it's secrets to you!

Reviews.Title: “Great.”
Reviews.Author: eri777
Reviews.Content: Located in a very beautiful place.In the heart of Venice.Is close to the gondola service.I am very pleased by the hotel service.With a balcony on the ground floor where the moments pass very quiet and romantic.Not only the hotel but all Venice was wonderful.A spring weekend where I would like to spend evry year.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as expected but definately wouldn't recommend or go back”
Reviews.Author: Chuggie
Reviews.Content: Having read the negative reviews on this hotel I was extremely nervous about staying here. We didn't choose this hotel. Before I go any further I have to explain this was a family trip and had it been our decision, we would definately not have booked this hotel. It is extremely expensive for what it is but we were only staying for 2 nights. That said, upon arrival we found the staff to be friendly and although the room wasn't ready, they did point us to the bar and we waited a short time to go to the room. We were in room 1205. The room was tired but clean and to be honest a fair size for 2 adults and a toddler. It has a wooden floor rather than the tired and dirty looking carpets that many of the other rooms had. We had both a bath and shower (over the bath) and it was clean. The aircon did work and the windows closed! We know we must have got lucky having ready some of the reviews! There are rooms literally 2 steps across the street which are in the 'new' block' and they are much better....definately worth requesting. Breakfast is very average. You can find something but the room is very cramped for the amount of people staying there. The biggest plus for this hotel is that the location is fantastic and all the sights are very easy to get too. On a side note Venice is VERY expensive and very busy. A 330ml bottle of beer ranges from 5 to 10.50 Euro's depending on where you are and everywhere is crowded. Go with a good budget and be prepared to have to 'work' your way through the city but it is worth the experience. I would suggest doing your reseach I know you will find much better hotels for a similar price in a similar location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Poor”
Reviews.Author: ba8101
Reviews.Content: Can best be described as one and a half star accommodation. The room is excessively small. The room stinks of cigarette smoke. Bags were supposed to be delivered to our rooms but had to lug them up to the second floor myself. Would have to be one of the biggest dumps I've stayed in. Location is great as is view from the room buit that is of second importance to comfort . No restaurant so have to eat out where you will get ripped off of every euro you have. Must be in Italy!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodations; Excellent Location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: KBudz
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel -- the rooms were spacious, the breakfast gave us many choices, and the staff very friendly and helpful. Loved the view overlooking the gondolas (you have to ask for a canal view). The hotel is clean, and located minutes away from San Marco Piazza and the ferries to local islands.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, don't listen to the others!”
Reviews.Author: RyanSmith13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Cavalletto for three nights from 2nd July and found it nothing like all of the reviews we've read. Most reviews comment on rude staff, bad bedrooms and unkept reception rooms. The room was small yes, but it wasnt unkept (bed was one of the most comfortable beds i've ever had in a hotel). The shower was small yes, but pressure was perfectly adequate. Breakfast was great, the reception staff were very professional, and preferred if you attempted to speak their language, rather than answering back to their polite greeting with 'Morning', understandable. At the end of the day, no need to listen to all of the people complaining about small rooms, if you are going to Venice to stay in the room then there's not much point going to Venice in the first place. For the time we spent in the hotel it was the absolute perfect base, right next to St Mark's Square, lobby/restaurant and bar areas were immaculately furnished and there are four great little balconies over the Orseolo basin, for drinking and watching gondolas. This hotel is fantastic value for money considering al of the above. If you want to be close to the sights, St Mark's square is literally 20 steps away. All round, perfect stay and would not hesitate in booking again.

Reviews.Title: “I manage a hotel, and this is the worst hotel I have stayed in many years.”
Reviews.Author: hotelguy2010
Reviews.Content: I manage a hotel, (GM), so I understand lapse in service, etc. But this hotel is truly not worth staying at. The front desk staff was rude, they did not answer the phone. The wallpaper in my room was peeling, no art work. Shower pressure was poor. The price was way to high compared to what you get. I suggest you do not use this property. Very very dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased we chose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: harrysims0701
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the recent reviews, I am very surprised with the negative comments. We had a fantastic room which was on a corner overlooking the canals. Very spacious, lots of light and clean and tidy bathroom. Our room doesn't look like any of the photos on tripadvisor. Only the carpet let it down - a little dated!!! I'm pleased the air conditioning system worked otherwise we would have baked - temperatures soured into the high twenties, although the air con. did not go off during the night, so take some earplugs. Breakfast was OK, but not a great deal of choice. For us traditional Brits it's bacon and omelette, but nice english tea! This hotel is in a good location just off St Marks Square and five minutes walk to the nearest vaparetto. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel we have ever stayed in!!!”
Reviews.Author: AandE18
Reviews.Content: On arrival the hotel its location looked very good, directly behind St Mark's Square and next to one of the busy gondola stations which many of the room overlook. On entry to the so called 4* HOTEL it was pretty much down hill from there and I can guarantee with this hotel looks are VERY deceiving, the last refurbishment that hotel must have received was in the 1970's. We were charged 300 euros a night for one of the worst rooms we have ever stayed in! We were taken to our room by the bell boy who looked more like a member of the maintenance staff, dressed in overalls and what looked like steel-toe capped boots. When he opened the door to our room which was situated on the 3rd floor directly next to the lifts I almost cried, our last night in Venice was certainly going to be a night to remember for all the wrong reasons! For 300 euro's we had a very basic double-bed 1 pillow each, no duvet, 2 side tables, a vanity table with a mirror so high up the wall you can not even see yourself when sat on the chair, a very small free standing wardrobe and a minibar with the TV on top, oh and no curtains only white drapes! You could also clearly hear every footstep from the room above and the walls between the rooms and corridors are paper-thin and you can clearly hear everything and anything going on out there. Ensuite had very bad damp, wood rot around the architraves, lime scale on the shower-head, grotty old shower curtain and an old rubber bath met. The buffet style breakfast which you pay 15 euros each for is a choice of cheese, ham, bacon, water drenched omelet, variety pack cereal, yoghurt, or toast, tea and coffee and machine orange or grapefruit juice. Do not have any drinks in the bar, there are no menus available so you do not know how much it is going to cost you untill you receive the bill, we had a G&T and a Majito which came to the total of 27 euros. One thing I can guarantee is that you will see so much of Venice as you will not want to spend any time in your hotel room. A HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT!!!

Reviews.Title: “My Worst Hotel Experience in Twenty Years of Travel”
Reviews.Author: CarrollTHarriss
Reviews.Content: Price-gouging is to be expected during the Venice Biennale, so I did not object to paying â‚¬500 per night for a room not much bigger than a closet, but I did object to the black mold in the bathroom, the fact that the staff repeatedly would not bother to pick up the phone even after twenty rings, and their general discourtesy bordering on contempt. Even though the elevator was facing the front desk, and very close to it, not once did a staff member even so much as look up to acknowledge my presence, much less utter a greeting. The hotel promised free internet and issued a code, but the code did not work when I used it, and the hotel access screen demanded a credit card payment of â‚¬25. I tried calling the front desk to ask how this could be, but they never answered. The next day they simply sniffed that it was my problem since I should have called the front desk. But that day the internet service did not work at all, and all the staff could do was shrug. When I called a manager, he simply refused even to try to address the problem and seemed almost triumphant. On another occasion, I asked would to pay for the room in cash and not have the charge go to my credit card. The staff member immediately called the front desk manager who immediately became very aggressive. This is not a matter of a cultural difference. I speak Italian as well as I speak English. My wife, however, speaks English, and the staff was even more rude to her. Only the housekeeping staff was courteous. On the whole, this was a nasty experience.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience”
Reviews.Author: baywatch188057
Reviews.Content: For sure this hotel is well located but it is the only positive thing about it. It is way too expensive in comparison with the service and the quality of the room. The room was old and was smelling cigarette even if it was a non-smoking room. The bathroom was very small and dirty, the curtain and the walls were covered with mold. The breakfast was poor, and when we arrived for breakfast no "good morning" or "hello" just "room number!" was asked to us. The isolation of the rooms is very bad. We could hear the showers, toilets and doors of our neighbors. We asked reception for a good restaurant, they sent us to la Colombia, another bad address to avoid! The cuisine was so bad that we left before having finished just fed up. I don't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, great service, good value for high priced city”
Reviews.Author: eddingtondj
Reviews.Content: Have read good and bad about this hotel. My husband and I had no complaints. The location could not be improved upon. We had wonderful service - staff was multilingual and very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was very good and the hotel was clean. The bathroom was a little small and the tub/shower was difficult to move about in but other than that we found the hotel quite pleasant. The gondoliers pick up right outside the hotel lobby and the water taxi the hotel ordered for us to get to and from the airport also pulled right up to the lobby. The bar had a few small balconies over a canal and we had drinks and snacks while watching the gondoliers before going out for dinner each evening. The rates weren't cheap but then nothing is in Venice. We stayed for 6 nights and were quite happy with our choice of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Cavalletto came to our rescue”
Reviews.Author: CCTibs
Reviews.Content: We had a bad start to our holiday in Venice when our meet and greet person through Apartments In Italy was rude, arrogant and unhelpful and left us abandoned in an apartment that was dirty. We went to Best Western Cavalletto and asked whether they had a room for 2 nights. Stefano on Reception could see that we were obviously distressed and we were offered a room with a balcony overlooking the lagoon and the Gondolas. We quickly packed our bags and moved into our lovely clean, spacious room. We found all staff to be friendly, breakfast was good and the view out of the windows to the Gondolas and their drivers was superb. Thanks for making our Venice trip memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, in the center of the city and amusement”
Reviews.Author: BÃ¼lent E
Reviews.Content: Cavalletto E Doge Orseolo is a very nice hotel. We were there for the carnival. The hotel is just a few steps away from the St. Marco square. Hence, it is in the heart of the crowd, amusement, joy and everything.

Reviews.Title: “It is not a four stars hotel, for sure”
Reviews.Author: EduardoPeixoto
Reviews.Content: It is not a four stars hotel, for sure. The rooms are ok, the location is almost perfect, but the infraestructure does not support the rooms avaiable. When you pay for a breakfast, you expect a breakfast. They offer you a joke. If the rate is less than US$150, okay. For more than that, try another option

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel in the old style”
Reviews.Author: bagendbags
Reviews.Content: This hotel is deceptive in its size but the standard of service by it's classically trained staff is amazing even down to their patience with clients who haven't spoken Italian for a while! We stayed in the annexe but although there was no canal view, the room was spacious, clean and beautifully decorated. The original building is very old, 1300's and one breakfasts overlooking the gondola "parking area" which is so interesting to see. The position of the hotel is amazing, over one small bridge and you are literally in St Mark's Square. Take up their offer of a trip to Murano for free (one way only!) and you even get a ride on a speedboat through the canals and across the lagoon, wonderful experience. Get the public boat back. We can't wait to go again Mary Lewis

Reviews.Title: “our stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: coppert
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Cavalletto E Doge Orseolo Hotel in Venice for two nights in September 2010. The Hotel was old and rundown with small crampted rooms. This hotel is in two parts connected over a ramp and very confusing finding your way to your room. The porters were extremely rough with our suitcases and even damaged them, and were surly in their attitude towards guests, maybe as the porters were grossly under staffed. The only good feature of this hotel that it was in an excellent location and within minutes of all major attractions. A very, very exspensive hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel to spend your honeymoon in!”
Reviews.Author: paul826nas
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was part of a 3 city trip for our honeymoon and was recommended to us by KUONI as a lovely romantic getaway, and as the world and his wife believes this is the romance capital of the world. what a shock!!!! the horror started at the front desk with the appallingly rude and unhelpful reception staff who should seriously be fired. We were then shown to our "luxury honeymoon room" which was not even in the hotel itself, but in an annex across the canal linked by numerous flights of stairs, which yiu have to carry your own bags to. Once in the room i thought i had been transported back in time to a 1950's bedsit, it was horrendous ! it smelled damp, and in the middle of the room was a "portable air con unit that must have been dragged up from the Titanic. Despite complaining with extreme vigour i was fobbed off by reception with a couldn't care less attitude. during the night it felt as if we were being eaten alive by mossies as the air con unit had to vent via the permanently nailed open window. as you can expect this caused she who must be obeyed to feel " a little dipleased" at how rubbish this place was and wanted to leave immediately. following hours of ranting and raving at the staff and phone calls to KUONI we were eventually moved to a small room in the main hotel which was decidely mediocre. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL if you like good service, clean rooms and helpful and friendly staff as you will be very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position but staff preocupied”
Reviews.Author: KFJH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early November 2010 for a short autumn break. The hotel is an an excellent position just off St.Marks Square and is slightly quirky in the best Venician tradition. It also appears to be the main staging point for the local Gondoliers which is interesting to watch at breakfast time. Breakfast was average but we didn't eat dinner although the menu looked nice. Junior members of staff were helpful but older more senior members uninterested and tetchy. Venice is very expensive so well worth moving away from the Tourist areas, avoid 'Tourist Menus', wines are cheap to buy in shops.

Reviews.Title: “5 star location”
Reviews.Author: razor26
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, great room all that we required over looking the open air pool ! Would not hesitate to re visit. Although the Gondolas were outside our room and did like to speak in a loud voice particually in the morning this added to the atmosphere..what do you expext you are in Venice Italy. Loved it...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Rooms, Helpful but unsmiling staff, Would Do Again”
Reviews.Author: use_2_love_2_travel
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here before and after a cruise this summer. We arrived early in the morning and the bell man was helpful and friendly about storing our luggage until later in the day. The rooms were clean and very European Elegant (not luxurious). The beds were not particularly comfortable, but after a day of sightseeing we slept soundly regardless. The bathroom was large, clean and everything worked. The front desk staff was helpful but without any hint of a smile at any time. The location cannot be beat! The hotel is around the corner from St. Mark's Square, and about a 10 minute walk to either the water bus terminals there or the water bus terminals and the shopping at Rialto. It overlooks a gondola docking area and it was fun and interesting to watch the gondolas being put to sleep for the night and set up in the morning. We had no view from the rooms, but the breakfast room overlooked the gondola dock.

Reviews.Title: “ONE GOOD THING IS LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: MegandBert
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my husband and two friends with Kuoni (that's another story). Arrived at hotel approx 12 noon only to be told we had to hang around for two hours until 2pm for room. On arrival there was an uncomfortable argument going on regarding a stolen wallet with one of the guests and this should have given us a clue as to the care and attention the staff here give (virtually none). The rooms are very small and in desparate need of re-decoration as there was more than just the odd scuff mark on the walls! We had one meal (apart from breakfast) in the hotel and it was poor to say the least - the menu was quite uninspiring - chips with everything! The only thing really this hotel had going for it was the location being just a few metres away from St Mark's Square. From here we went on to the Grand in Verona (excellent) and the Continental in Sirmione, Lake Garda (also excellent). Frankly if this is an example of a Best Western hotel then I would be very wary of staying in any one of them again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Venice Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kjbms
Reviews.Content: The hotel is what you'd typically find in Venice - very old. The rooms were small but the air worked well. The bathrooms were a good size but the shower drained too slowly. The water almost filled up the bottom before you could finish showering. The staff was average; they weren't overly eager to help. The location is great - central to San Marco. The breakfast was average. The did provide free wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Uncooperative management with a lack of concern for their patrons”
Reviews.Author: osheaeliz
Reviews.Content: When checking in, we received the room key only with no mention of a seperate key to the safe. As in most European countries, you are expected to leave your room key at the front desk when going out, which we did. These keys are clearly visible and accessible to the ongoing pedestrian traffic in the lobby of the hotel. In addition, the keys to the safe are also hanging next to the room key, clearly indicating which rooms have valuables locked in the safe while the current resdients are out. After being out after midnight during an annual Venetian festival on a Saturday night, we came home to the room to find the armoire doors wide open and our safe broken. Clearly this was not how we left the room. When we reported this "break-in" to the desk manager, Adriano, he was eager to dismiss us. Initially he blamed the maids, and then insisted that we must have broken the safe. He reluctantly came up to the room with us to demonstrate how the armoire doors sometimes just open on their own- which they did not. We wanted to file a police report to have a written record that someone had been in our room. While we did not have anything in the safe, we were unsure at the time if anything had been removed from our suitcases and our bags. Again, Adriano insisted that if nothing had been taken from the safe, there was no reason for the police. We did not let it go, and after arguing persistently with him about calling the police, they did finally arrive. Unfortunately, they did not speak English, so Adriano was our translator. He ultimately told us we could go the police station in the morning to explain to them that our room was broken into and nothing was stolen but someone "...touched our dresses." In the morning, we insisted on speaking to the General Manager, but he was conveniently off that day. With futher insistence, he was called on the telephone by one of the front desk mangers, but refused to speak with us. Regardless of whether or not something is stolen, breaking and entering is a crime, even in Italy, and the fact that Adriano and the general manager were so eager to dismiss us is appalling. Knowing that the police had been called to the hotel the previous evening should have been enough for the GM to express his concern to us, whether in person or on the telephone. There is no way to know whether this was an inside job, or how many other rooms were entered under false pretenses that night or any other night, but I would not take the chance staying there again. Something just didn't add up and they were too quick to try and sweep it under the rug.

Reviews.Title: “Fair hotel...”
Reviews.Author: kdmc0408
Reviews.Content: The staff wasn't very friendly & the room was just fair. The bed wasn't comfortable, the bathroom was a decent size, but the "hair dryer" was awful...take your own. Our room did overlook the main gondola pick up site, so it was fun to watch the gondoliers at work.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Only”
Reviews.Author: Noelehua
Reviews.Content: This hotel staff is rude, rude. Location is theonly ting good about the hotel. They live in the pass with the rest of Venice. Over rated.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: rareynolds2000
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Venice at the 4* Bonvechiatti last year, and viewed the Cavelletto 4* hotel from the outside, it seemed very appealing located on the canal basin. Unfortunately, my stay was disappointing. The room was cramped, the air conditioning was not operating, we had no shampoo bottles, the bath would not drain water, and the one meal I had in the restaurant was the worst during my week's stay. My first choice of main meal was not available (from a limited menu); my second choice was tastless and small. After two basic courses we were presented with a 12 euro cover charge - even though we were guests staying in the hotel - plus a 15% service charge, making a poor meal extortionately expensive. The hard-working lone waiter was trying to cope while receiving complaints from us and others. The reception staff were reasonably friendly; a young girl was very helpful but next time I return to Venice, I will again use the Bonvechiatti which provided me with an excellent room and service - I would not recommend the Cavelletto.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and Unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: John_and_Ann_Wilkins
Reviews.Content: Sent there at 11p.m (with about 50 others) for two nights by airline due to flight cancellation. Reception was officious and unfriendly. The manager took pleasure in "slagging off" the airline and was reluctant to accommodate us even though he had rooms, but he said only for one night. No offer of help with bags - even for older passengers. Rooms were OK but parquet flooring gave them a cold feel. Six drinks in the bar cost â‚¬70. No smiles from any member of staff! We checked out after one night (as advised when we checked in). We later found that there were enough rooms for a second night but that they did not confirm this until late in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location excellent breakfasts comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowSuzy
Reviews.Content: Service was helpful and friendly. Our room was very comfortable with excellent bathroom and shower. Slight downside was we had no view to speak of but it did not matter as we were out most of the time. The breakfast room was lovely overlooking the basin where the gondolas collected. The breakfasts were excellent hot and cold purvey on offer. We were unfortunate to spend 4 nights here when the weather was atrocious! Heavy snow and bitterly cold. However it was a joy to come back to the hotel as it was heated to perfection.Much appreciated after a cold day sightseeing! We would reccomend it as the location etc.was first class.

Reviews.Title: “I'm sorry but....do not go there!”
Reviews.Author: Hospitalitymaster
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone! When booking a hotel, I usually look the comments and this hotel was ranked as a middle class hotel but still, a 4 star hotel. My friend and I first time in Venice should have been better than that and we were a lot dissapointed by this hotel. I chose this hotel because of its location by san Marco Square which is their main avantage but location isn't service, comfort and good staff. Above all, knowing that Venice is small, a hotel in another area is not bad at all. Check in was ok. We arrived around 4.00 pm and they were a few at the reception and finally someone greeted us! Quite a nice person without a gum in his month compared to the others. He showed us the room and told us that we were in the other side of the hotel, in the renovated section. This was a comfortable room but the smell was very intense. The moisture (Venice is under water 2 times a day due to the tides) made us open the window!. Housekeeping staff did their job! They replace the trashes, the bath towels and did our bed normaly. I was really disapointed because of their staff, namely a few at the front desk. I would not like to work there at all! It is a very cold atmosphere (because certainly of their management) and answers were "no" al the time. Gums in their mouths and we never heard something like " Have a nice day" or " How was your day?" Nobody talked to us and that is shame...Guests in a hotel need to be visible by the staff. We stayed there 2 nights and felt invisible and not taken care of. If you booked there, I certainly not recommend you to deal with a person named Jacob, who was so so rude with us. I don't even imagine that he works in a hotel. Here is a call to Best western Management ( which I am sure as managers they will read me) , YOU need to change your staff and the quality of services provided in this hotel. For me having worked in many hotels worldwide, this hotel needs a Front of House Manager definitely guests oriented to make sure customers are treated well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: nigel82a
Reviews.Content: The location is great, just off St Mark's Square, which makes it a good centre to explore Venice. It also makes it very easy to find, which is a huge plus point as Venice is an absolute labyrinth. It's a very old building, so it rambles up and down and the rooms are different sizes, but ours was perfectly adequate, and the bathroom had just been refurbished and was very clean and spacious. Breakfast could be a bit of a scrum, but the food was fine, usual continental buffet of cold meats, cheeses, pastries and something that looked like an omelette had mated with a pancake. Can't understand some of the rubbish reviews, we found the staff helpful, the rooms clean and OK our room looked out over some rooftops, but so do most rooms in old cities. A canal view room costs quite a bit extra. One caveat if you find stairs difficult - there is an annex ewhich has now been joined to the main hotel but only at second floor level. The only lift is in the main building, so we had to go on the lift to floor 2.5, down a few steps, over the bridge and then up two flight of stairs to get to our 4th floor rooms. OK if you're hale and hearty. But overall, we'd go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended for a stay, but have a drink on the patio &owatch the gondoliers”
Reviews.Author: time2share
Reviews.Content: Centrally located. If high tide and St Mark is flooded, the water will be to high to approach hotel from the dock and you will need to drag your luggage thru St Marks to reach the hotel on your own. Room walls construction poor quality, like low quality trailer walls, no insulation, hear every sound. We had 5 adults, 3 rooms. Two of the keys from different rooms where interchangable. No too safe. Everyday the bathroom shower would clog partially and drain slowly, same with the sink. Light out in one of the lamps, had to have replaced upon arrival. Not too organized. Rooms small.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful :)”
Reviews.Author: vonz30
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. First off it sits on a Gondola docking bay and you can sit out on the small deck watching the gondolas and life go passed it's just beautiful. We arrived early and our room was ready. We came in via vaporetto and walked thru St Marks Sq with our gear which was fine, the hotel is right on square which is fantastic because after a few hours in Venice you will see how easy it is to get lost in what I call the maze, so it was always easy enough to navigate our way back to the hotel. Friendly staff, very helpful and also multilingual. Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from a "4-star hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Pinayogini
Reviews.Content: My friends and I paid a discounted 50% off the normal rates because it was the low season (flood season to be precise) but I can't imagine ever paying the normal â‚¬700 rate for a 4d/3n stay in this hotel! The location is great because it's right smack in the middle of Piazza San Marco, but that's the only thing I like about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: ruthfa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of October. Considering this has a rating of a 4 star hotel we were not at all happy by several aspects of the hotel (given the coast of it and the rating). Firstly on arrival we were treated as a bit of an inconvenience and it was quite rushed and stressful with instructions barked at us. We were shown to our room which was in the "annex" (see later). It was very very small it just about fitted a bed and a desk. Also was very very dark (but we managed to operate the shutters outside the windows to get round this problem). The bathroom had mising light bulbs. On having a bath or shower (shower tiny) the water took 30 mins to drain after each person - there was clearly a problem with the drains. The fan in the bathroom was also not very effective and did not get rid of the accumalated steam (it disappeared naturally after keeping the bathroom door open for 40 mins). This probably explained the slightly musty smell in the room and bathroom. As to the "annex" this is a seperate part of the hotel which is in the lane opposite. The major inconvenience is having to be buzzed in each time we wanted to leave the room. On to breakfast the room is very small. If you timed your visit wrong it was really difficult to move around the room carrying plates and drinks without bumping into other people. At these times it was everyone for themselves in the scrum. Overall like most things in Venice this is a very expensive hotel that does not live up to its billing. Its location is great just off St Marks square. However location is not everything in Venice its easy to walk anywhere or get the vaperetto. Unless you can get this hotel for what you consider to be a reasonable price I wouldnt bother. Either way due to the condition of the room it is certainly not a 4 star hotel. Tips : Wifi is actually free if you have your own laptop (only works in the lobby) - they dont advertise this in english anywhere. There is a lovely balcony along from reception overlooking the gondolas (used for a smoking area) but have a look its really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: HonestTraveller87
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel late on a Thursday night, found it really easily from the boat drop off. Checked in and were shown up to our lovely but small room (not that we were bothered, who goes on holiday to sit in their hotel room?!!). We went back down to reception who pointed us in the right direction to get food that late at night. The next day we went for a good look around and couldnt believe how brilliant the location of this hotel is! About a 30 second walk from St Marks Square and 5 minutes from the Rialto Bridge. All in all we had a brilliant stay and if we ever go back to Venice I would consider this hotel again. Only bad bit were the breakfasts weren't great if you had a wine head!!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: HobokenBen
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for 3 nights with the specific request of 2 single beds, as I was travelling with my brother, used 108,000 Best Western Rewards points, confirmed well in advance and with confirmation e-mails in hand checked in. The first two rooms I was shown were tiny . dark, badly worn and with one full size bed, totally unsuitable. After some behind the front desk whispering with the manager, I was shown a room across the the alley which was much better and had two single beds. The location is excellent, the breakfast was just basic and since I had to get my key from the desk, being buzzed in on the other side of the narrow alley from the lobby was not a problem. Venice is expensive and you are paying even more for the location at the Cavaletto. Make sure you ask for what you want before hand have them confirm it before you book and speak up if you are not being given what you expected.

Reviews.Title: “THE PERFECT LOCATION IN A VERY GOOD PRICE”
Reviews.Author: Antonis7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the heart of Venice so it makes your exploration in Venice much more easier. We had the luck to early book the room in a very good price (99 euros per night) which I think is a very good price. In general our staying was very pleasant, the staff was very helpful and the room clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldleee
Reviews.Content: This hotel was set in a perfect spot. The room was gorgeous and extremely romantic. The breakfast buffet had variety and the croissants were to die for. We splurged for a canal view and it was sooo worth it. I would not hesitate to stay here again. Room was clean and dÃ©cor was luxurious. Bathroom was clean and modern. Great Hotel, great place to visit!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dubliner00
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 day stay at The Cavalletto e Doge. It's in a great location and very easy to find just off San Marco. The room was small but very clean, (as was the rest of the hotel). The staff were pleasant and efficient and the breakfast food was pretty good too. I was a bit apprehensive about staying there having read some of the reviews , but am happy to say I was pleasantly surprised. Tony. Dublin, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Unspectacular and poor value”
Reviews.Author: alremotemail
Reviews.Content: At the train station, the water taxi refused to go to the hotel, saying it is difficult to access. At San Marco, we lugged heavy luggages up and down bridges under the hot sun with a young child. At the hotel, they told us their special arrangement taxi company would have come to the back of the hotel, at the gondole park. Why didn't they tell us this when we booked? The rooms are plain and 3 stars, but at the same price as our rooms at the Westin Excelsior on Via Veneto in Rome! The showers leaked water all over the floor, in all our 3 rooms. It is not possible the hotel doesn't know about this, yet they did nothing to fix it. Location is great because it is just off San Marco, although most places are within walking distance in Venice anyway.

Reviews.Title: “The location is 4 star but not the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Emeraldisle85
Reviews.Content: Finding the hotel proved more a challenge than first thought even with two maps-when asked locals they didnt know the hotel. It is right opposite the Hard Rock Cafe in Venice,behind St. Marks Square for reference for others planning to visit the hotel. On arrival,it looks the same as the pictures on the internet. Very authentic and venitian and a nice intimate reception area with a look at the canal. The room however left a lot to be desired for a 4 star hotel in our opinion. While it was clean with good quality bed linens, the room, a "Classic standard double room" had dated decor,limited storage and was very limited on space in the room overall. The shower was a very very compact size which might prove to be a major inconvenience for some people. Breakfast was a typical continental breakfast, which was okay but nothing spectuclar-coffee,croissaints,cereal,ham,cheese and breads,etc. The view from the restaurant is beautiful as it looks out onto a canal but a cafe latte was 7 euro and other beverages being quite expensive. A shot of vodka without a mixer was 14 euro. The service in the hotel was satisfactory, with all staff having a friendly manor. The location of the hotel was fantastic for both tourist attractions and key shopping areas with an array of Italian and International designers within steps. This was probably the best thing about the hotel. If you are looking for a hotel in the heart of venice, then this is most definitely is it but awarding it a 4 star classification is most definitely a matter of opinion,and personally, the location is the only feature of the hotel which warrants a four star classification.

Reviews.Title: “NO WAY 4 STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: smc83
Reviews.Content: We had 5 rooms in this hotel since we were 11 and booked through Orbitz! We chose this hotel for various reasons, read reviews in Trip Advisor, and saw part of it in a tv program for cruises. There is no possible way this is a 4 star hotel!!! The only good thing about this hotel is the location, which is right off St Marks square - as well as the a/c which works very well. These are the only good things I can mention. First of all - the staff is not helpful at all and all have attitudes. The rooms are tiny tiny tiny, The view in the 5 rooms we had was a wall and the elevator is from the 1950's. When we reached our room with our luggage, which we had to carry ourselves, the rooms are located at intermediate levels, so you cant reach it on the floor you choose, therefore we had to go up and down the stairs to reach the rooms. We had been traveling for 3 wks so we had big lugagge. I do speak a bit of Italian so I understood when the front desk clerk told the other one to let us handle the luggage ourselves. In the shower is very hard to clean your feet since they are tiny tiny and very square. I had read of reviewers about the hotel in front and that some were moved from location, but I asked to see all the rooms and the fact is that they are all the same. The rooms look old and musty and leave much to be desired. I mentioned that I would be writting a review and he said he didnt care (a young man named Stefano from the night shift) When I asked for a water taxi to the airport they told us it would be 220 Euros, we found one for 100!!! the truth of the matter is that they do not care at all for guests and believe they are doing you a favor by answering questions. I rather not keep writting because I really am furious with this hotel, as were all the members in my party which range from 14 to 70 yrs of age.

Reviews.Title: “Great room & service”
Reviews.Author: Pixdale
Reviews.Content: Located just off of St. Mark's Square you are definitely in the heart of things in Venice. The fact that the gondolas "park" just outside the door is great. Our room overlooked the gondola parking & was worth the splurge for a 2 night stay. The staff was very friendly & helpful. Breakfast was a good, typical European breakfast- get there early & have a table with a view of the gondoliers getting ready for the day! Easy to walk to all of the sights of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling Reception staff”
Reviews.Author: Mike340
Reviews.Content: A middle aged lady friend friend of ours was staying at this hotel. We met her for lunch after which the two ladies went up to the room to 'freshen up' as ladies do, and 10 minutes later I went to collect them from the room. I politely greeted the receptionist, who must have been the Italian star of 'Grumpy Old Men', and he asked me where I was going. I said : "Room (whatever it was)" and he said: " There is a lady in there". I replied that I was aware of that and that she was a friend and that I was going to fetch her and my wife. He then tried to block my access to the stairs and started shouting at me and pushing me away, swearing in Italian. I went up to the room regardless and suggested to our friend that she left and came to our pleasant little pension round the corner, as she had only checked in that morning and had also had a brush with this unpleasant person. We returned to reception with her luggage and explained that she was leaving. He continued with his abuse and grabbed one of the suitcases. I started to call the police, and was dialling the number when he backed down and literally threw the other case out into the street. As a matter of interest the hotel had a scruffy feel about it and the room was very tatty. I have ticked incredible staff in the box below. He certainly was, but not in the way you mean. I should probably add that I am middle aged and was dressed appropriately as one does for a visit to a city like Venice. There was no reason or excuse for such behaviour from this employee.

Reviews.Title: “a bit wet!”
Reviews.Author: ericleroiCheshire_uk
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel but boots needed when we were there. (feb)........ flooded reception depending on tides! fantastic location ; lovely canal views. during the "dry season" no problem!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: UKTravellers89
Reviews.Content: Beautifully positioned, just off ST Mark's Square, with our room directly overlooking a gondola basin. Excellent reception staff, and comfortable accommodation

Reviews.Title: “Great location but little else”
Reviews.Author: LondonTravellerTom
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in two rooms, one expensive "canal view". We chose the hotel as we were taking elderly relatives and wanted somewhere close to St Marks Square and also a hotel accessible by water taxi. Here are our thoughts: General: The hotel has a tired feel to it, think scruffy rather than faded glory. Location: This is very convenient for St Marks Square but (and it's a big but) if the square is flooded (which it often is) then you'll have to take a circuitous route to get to it which negates the purpose of staying in the hotel in the first place. Also if the tide is high then you can forget your plans of arriving / leaving by water taxi as they can't get under the bridges. We had to trek to the Rialto to get our taxi to the airport. Noisy: The rooms we stayed in were very noise transparent. Judging from the noises coming from the adjoining rooms Venice is very, very romantic.... Whilst having the Gondolas parked outside seems like a great idea, they are noisy from 7:30 onwards. Air-Con: Our rooms were hot but no air-con was available and we were told to open the windows. This introduced us to the insect population of Venice - they are a hardy lot, our plug-in mosquito killer seemed to have no effect. Also having the window open allowed us to enjoy the early morning shouts of the gondoliers into their mobile phones. Breakfast: Excellent for a two star hotel. Pity it's supposed to be four star. Front Desk: They were quick to answer any questions we asked them. If they'd actually given us the correct answers it would have helped eg. Q. "How long will it take to get a porter and how much will it cost to carry our bags to Rialto?" A. "Five minutes and ten euros." On the day it would actually have taken 35 minutes and cost 30 euros. We carried our own bags. Overall: The staff and management were polite but know you're only staying for a short while and probably won't return. However thanks to the internet and Trip Advisor you can find a better hotel and enjoy Venice to the full - it is magical.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Stay at the Cavalletto”
Reviews.Author: IngeborgHultenius
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling in Europe for 35 years. Hotel Cavalletto & Doge Orseolo in Venice, Italy has, without a doubt, the most unprofessional and surly group of concierge personnel that I have ever experienced. This was so unlike our previous experiences of Italy (same trip) that it was startling to us - and totally unexpected. I was more than willing to pay for assistance with our four large pieces of luggage, but the first concierge was reluctant to authorize his porter to assist - even though there were no other arriving guests at that point in time. Upon departure I asked for change for a 20 Euro note so that I could tip one of their employees. The concierge actually said, "No!". He finally condescended to provide the change. These are only two examples. There are more. In retrospect, I wonder if it was because we were both female - and American. I did not experience them treating male guests with the same boorish behavior so it certainly makes me wonder. The room itself was modest. Clean, quiet, and with a view of rooftops. Their hair dryer was broken and the shower head fell off while it was in use, but we were not motivated to report this to anyone given our experience at the front desk. I would strongly recommend that single women consider another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location !!”
Reviews.Author: SB1Epworth
Reviews.Content: The Cavalletto has a fantastic location just off St Mark's Square and central for everything in this fabulous city. If you come from the airport by water bus, or any other means, make your way to the square and head for the corner diagonally opposite the campanile tower. Between the shops there's an alley with a row of telephones. Cross the little bridge and you are at the hotel entrance. The reception staff are very helpful and when I asked for a room upgrade (I'm a Best Western Gold Crown Club member) they gave me a room overlooking the canal basin where a lot of the gondolas are stored on an evening and where all the activity begins on a morning. The guys who clean the boats arrive at about 7.30am and start getting them ready for the gondoliers who hang around, smoking and arguing with each other. It's hilarious! Anyway - ask for a canal view room when you book, it's worth it! The standard rooms are nicely decorated but small with not a great deal of room in them. Beautiful bathroom though. The staff are very quick - on a morning we'd leave the room to go for breakfast and when we came back 30 minutes later the room had been cleaned and made up. Breakfast is the usual European hotel fare with continental buffet of cheeses, meats etc, pastries, cereals, yogourts etc and some omelettes and bacon for those of us who can't resist. The hotel doesn't offer lunch or dinner but step outside the door and you have the choice of what seems like thousands of restaurants. One particularly nice feature of this hotel is that off reception there are three small balconies, great for sitting with a drink on an evening and watching the world go by. One of them is actually a tiny jetty from which the hotel staff will hail you a gondola or from which you can get collected by a fantastic water taxi to take you back to the airport in true style. (It will cost you 100 euros though!) Overall, a great medium sized hotel, very helpful and friendly staff and an awesome location. I'd come back, no problem!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Hagrinas
Reviews.Content: I spent several days in this hotel at the tail end of a trip. The hotel is easy to find if you are told the location and directions, but very difficult to find otherwise. Because of an error on the part of my travel agent, and due to the lack of traditional street addresses in Venice, I was able to find the hotel's location only after searching half a dozen guide books in a bookstore. A typical tourist map might not suffice. Then it was a matter of knowing that once you get inside Piazza San Marco, you step over a bridge and you are there. Facing North (away from the Grand Canal) it's the second little bridge from the far left. Getting there by vaporetto, which is a water bus, is simple and you get to see the Grand Canal on the way. If you go by water taxi, which proved to be a convenient way to depart, you just use the hotel's private dock. Since I went with a family of five, I'd think twice about taking the water bus again with all the luggage, but I didn't hear complaints from the kids. The advantage of a water taxi is that you don't need to know how to get there. But the vaporetti are cheaper, and you can get a ticket that's good for a few days. Stepping into the hotel was a relief from the hot sun, and it was nice to have the bellman there to get the luggage. Since the hotel is hundreds of years old, the architect did not consider how to get to my room by elevator. I had to take the elevator to floor 2A, go down a few steps to a hallway, and then up two full flights of steps. In many cases, a particular building in Venice might have started out as several adjacent ones, so floor plans often make little sense. I had two rooms, and they were both comfortable. They were not remarkable for a four star hotel, nor was there anything wrong with them in particular. They had the expected amenities, plus flat panel TVs, and mini bars that barely cooled things. If you want to listen to romantic Italian music, there's a switch on the wall for it. It also plays the music in the bathroom, which was also well equipped. It's perfectly suited for a romantic trip. Given the location, you will probably not spend much time inside the rooms, and being able to step in and out of Piazza San Marco is more than just a matter of having a room in the heart of the main attraction. After spending hours at one of the key attractions, it's nice to be able to step into your room, rest or freshen up, and be right back there. Aside from sleeping and showering, you'll probably want to take advantage of the included breakfast, which I thought was slightly better than typical Italian hotels of its class. It was buffet style, with no chef, but the variety was not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out”
Reviews.Author: AGCanada01
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a travel agent. We asked for a superior class room. What we got was a third class room. The first room we were taken to was in the old section of the hotel. The elevator went to the third floor, the room was on the 6th floor up a narrow staircase. The room was small and airless. We called the front desk which then sent someone to show us other small airless rooms. Finally, we agreed to spend an additional 50 euro per night (about $80 more a night) for a much better room. The whole process seemed like the classic bait and switch routine. We do not recommend staying at this hotel. AGCanada01

Reviews.Title: “Great lcation”
Reviews.Author: yentocs
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel very easly after taking the waterbus from the station.receptionist very pleasant ,we and our luggage taken to the room in a very fast lift.The room which was very clean overlooked the gondola mooring area which was very intersesting to watch.Why did the previous reviewer not use the safe in room?Found the walls abit thin but slept very well,clean sheets every day!Location near st marks sqr was great.brakfast fine<eat a lot venice is very expensive,Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Very close to St Marks sq”
Reviews.Author: cabby289
Reviews.Content: Lots of stars, took cheaper option of room not overlooking basin as you only sleep and shower in room which was slightly tired but real venetian.Lovely. To get the best veiw of the basin and gondolas which is packed with tourists during the day just sit at you breakfast table where it all starts about 10am. Area very quiet at night. Hotels externally recommended restaurant always seemed to be closed but plenty of others nearby up the ally to tha end and turn right.Avoid the self service one to the left as done with microwaves and horrible plus miserable staff. Generally Avoid weekends as better value and less crowded Our room was not as shown in the brochure but good and roomy for Venice. We have been to venice before and get our 3 day bus pass and use it well during the 3 days going to the islands ( plus rialto bridge at night) and spend the rest of the time walking the fasinating alleys and churches. Will return again to Venice and this time left on the Eurostar (first class is cheap if you book the day before) to go to Florence more good restaurants and walking

Reviews.Title: “Great Value at the Hotel Cavalletto E Doge Orseolo”
Reviews.Author: GM_Florida
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Cavalletto E Doge Orseolo in Venice is great value. It has very nice rooms, good services and a great location for seeing Vencie. The hotel is branded through the Best Western chain, which allows reservations to be made through the chainâ€™s web site. There are several Best Western hotels in the immediate vicinity, so you have to be specific. The hotel has all the modern conveniences, but has kept some of its old world charm.
