The rooms are tastefully furnished, good sized, and the double bed met all our expectations. The bath was modern and clean. By U.S. standards the shower was a bit tight, but it worked great and provided plenty of hot water. We didnâ€™t spend extra for the canal view room, and had a room that looked out over the small street and a courtyard to the rear of the hotel. It ended up being quite a quaint view, and was also pretty quiet. The elevators were sized for 2 or 3 people and were very accessible with luggage. The hotel tries to push an affiliated restaurant that is a few blocks away, and not the easiest to find. We looked it over during our sight-seeing and decided it was over-priced, even for Venice. There are quite a few good restaurants in the immediate neighborhood, and no need to get caught up in the hotel recommendation trap. This carries over to pushing private water taxis over the public vaporetto system. They pickup and drop off at the same spot for San Marco, with the private taxis being much more expensive. During the day, there appeared to be some remodeling underway on the next floor up. Of course, it was off-season, when I would expect such projects to be undertaken. The work didnâ€™t interfere much, and wrapped up fairly early in the day. The hotel is in a great spot, just off the north-west corner of Plaza San Marco. Itâ€™s accessible from the San Marco water-taxi stop, or through the plaza itself. The back-sideof the hotel is on a canal used for gondola pickup and â€˜parkingâ€™. This provides some great views from the breakfast room. Breakfast, by the way, is better than average and provide some American choices of bacon and eggs. On the whole, weâ€™d stay at the Cavalletto E Doge Orseolo again.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: bncStaffordshire
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived and I saw the words Best Western I was dissappointed - but I couldn't have been more wrong. Our room was gorgeous - overlooking the Gondala park. The decor was beautiful and the windows had lovely shutters and the windows opened fully with a window box full of flowers. The bathroom was huge! The breakfast was nothing specatular but was filling and tasty. The location was the best - right by the square - but still very quiet. The staff were very friendly and helpful - I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: KirklandJoy
Reviews.Content: On the recommendation of our travel again, we booked for our 1 night in Venice at what she called the Albergo Cavalletto & Doge Orseolo Hotel. We thought this would be a cute & charming pension type hotel, particularly since the rates were so much less than many of the other hotels we were checking out. Much to our surprise, upon arrival, lo and behold it's a Best Western. I was just about ready to be disappointed (because I wanted cute & charming pension type hotel), but when we got to our room I changed my mind and realized, it was just what I had hoped for, only much more spacious. The location couldn't be much more convenient (just behind San Marco Square), yet really very quiet (at least where our room was located--we looked down on the section of canal that was a "parking lot" for the gondolas. The staff was friendly, the breakfast included in the price of the room was nothing spectacular, but certainly sufficient and typical of the express-type hotel breakfasts. In terms of getting you and your luggage to a hotel in Venice, I'm not sure this was any more difficult than anywhere else, but it was certainly very dependent on the water levels--which, of course, meant that our timing was off and both coming and going we had to lug our cases to the nearest vaporetto stop because they were unable to dock at the hotel when we needed them to. So not for the faint of heart or else you need to hire a porter to do your dirty work from the nearest vaporetto stop. Other than that, this was a nice place to stay, much more European in feel (despite being a Best Western) and for the price, not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Treat Yourself”
Reviews.Author: skiingcouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights as a family group of 4 in 2 rooms. The rooms were in the new building across the passageway from reception and were a good size, with generously-sized bathrooms. We had de-luxe rooms which were well-furnished in typical traditional style, with good air-conditioning. Our double had a large bed and a sofa. Views only of rooftops but very quiet at all times. The special features of this hotel are: 1) the location just off St Mark's. An earlier reviewer gave most helpful directions to find the hotel - head for the corner on the clock side of Piazza San Marco but at the opposite end to St Mark's, look for the telephone kiosks and walk through past them and you will cross a small bridge and be at reception almost immediately. 2) the location on the canal basin means drinks can be had on a balcony overlooking the gondolas. Watch romantic couples set off with champagne and song for free or do it yourself from the hotel's own mooring. Breakfast also provides free entertainment as the gondoliers start their day. Venice is expensive and this hotel is not cheap but if you feel like treating yourself to an experience which will live in the memory, enjoy a glass of chilled Prosecco on the balcony in the evening and soak up the unique and magical atmosphere. Then stroll into Piazza San Marco to see the wonderful architecture by moonlight and hear the cafe bands - brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average Hotel but could improve in some areas”
Reviews.Author: travlinandyjr
Reviews.Content: I would say that most people would give the Hotel Cavalletto an Average rating. There are a few things that made us want to give it an ABOVE AVERAGE rating. The location is absolutely amazing. We stayed in #1104 from September 27th through the 30th. We had a small balcony overlooking a small side canal between the hotel and St. Marks Square. You could see into the square from our room. The other window looked over the canal where gondoliers store their gondolas at the end of the night. There is alot of noise during the day and early evening. If you don't like it, just close your window, it keeps the room quiet. The staff was friendly. The breakfast staff was amazing. They were the most friendly throughout our trip. The food is excellent. Lots to choose from. There are great views while having breakfast as well. Here are the things were the hotel can improve.... The hotel is aged. The wooden floors creak alot and the seams are coming apart. The walls and doors are thin. We often heard our neighbors several times during the night (I think they were on a honeymoon). The bathroom is pretty small. You can definatley do what you need to do, but plan on doing it alone. There is no sharing of the bathroom in this hotel because it is just to small. This was really the only bad things I could think of. The truth be told, the location, service and views (on the canal side only) really made me want to give this hotel an Above Average rating. I can honestly say that I WOULD return to the Cavalletto in the future. I hope they fix the floors though. Oh, by the way, it did flood the first day we were in Venice. The water did not enter the hotel but the access from St. Marks was cut off. Fortunately, if you walk the elevated walkways, you can access the hotel from the rear without getting your feet wet. One other suggestion, bring you own umbrellas. The hotel only has two for all guests.

Reviews.Title: “Part Of a honeymon 2night stop over in Venice”
Reviews.Author: SimonEllis1971
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent we were lucky enough to have our room upgrade to one with a balcony overlooking the Gondola pick up point. At what is near the front. The hotel position is superb and right next to the main St Marks square. The staff are superb very helpful and friendly, the rooms and beds are superb clean comfortable and this is one of the few hotels in Venice that will let you use an Iron free of charge handy if your on the move or travelling about. At night time it is quiet and child friendly. We had breakfast which was all good. The hotel is quite far away about 1KM from the main St Marco / St Marks water taxi drop off point so bear this in mind as it's very difficult with cases to get to witrh travel bags or without cases it's no problem at all, it is quite difficult to find as it's known locally under a few names mostly as the "Cavaletto" or "Best Western" who have recently taken it over. Kuoni listed it as the Doge Orselo which made it difficult to find. I'd recommend printing the map from their site before going as it's not marked on the map you get from everyone inc tourist information in Venice. It costs about 14 EURO each from the train station to the main bridge then it's a 20min trek with cases to get to, or you can get a Water taxi direct from the airport for 100 EURO although again you have to walk from the arrivals building to the water taxi rank 1KM.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: KMarie8
Reviews.Content: We like to stay in Best Westerns when we travel in Europe because the quality is much higher than here in the states and The Cavaletto was about 3.5 stars. The hotel is very charming, as most are in Venice, but it's a bit of a maze and can be a little confusing to get around. And despite having an elevator, you can end up walking up and down a lot of stairs depending on where your room is. The decor of the rooms was average (they need some updating), but they were clean and not too small. The portable air conditioners kept the rooms cool, but it wasn't very clear how to operate them and we ended up freezing our first night. Also, and this isn't a very big deal but was annoying enough for me to mention, the hairdryer was bolted down into a drawer in the desk in the bedroom and there was no mirror anywhere near it...it was just poor design. The best part about this hotel is it's location...steps from St. Mark's square. We could tuck the kids into bed and head down to the square for drinks and music knowing the girls were only 2 minutes away. *Tip- Take a private water taxi to and from the train station. We didn't know there was "door to door" service available when we arrived and took a "water bus" instead which was a HUGE pain with all of our bags. The Cavaletto is right next to a large gondola launch and water taxis can bring you right to the front door of the hotel. It's more expensive, but definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Shelter in the Storm....”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeTX
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for two nights culminating a 15 day trip to Italy. Arriving abut 11:30PM after a miserable 12 hours on a train with multiple delays etc, we struggled with our luggage to find a water bus taxi to the deserted St. Marcos (Mark's) Square arriving in a torrential downpour. Consequently by the time we found our way to the hotel, we were exhausted, wet, starved and somewhat apprehensive. This hotel exceeded our expectations from the beginning of our stay to the end especially after having heard about some of the problems with hotels in Venice. Other than the high rates (euro exchange & general cost of Venice) we cannot complain. We found the room small but cmfortable & adequate... and quickly raided the snack basket and stocked bar while changing into dry clothes to search for a restaurant. We soon discovered a fact about Venice in that hardly any locals live there (cannot afford it and commute to the mainland) and hence few service providing places stay open late. The hotel restaurant WAS closed but the barman took pity on us and raided the closed kitchen serving us a wonderful lasagna meal even though he was very busy. Location is fantastic....exit the door , cross a small foot-bridge and you are actually IN St. Mark's Square. And only about 2 blocks from the Grande Canal and public transportation. Gondola rides are available at the side of the hotel and the motorized water taxi we ordered to take us to the airport actually picked us off the hotel balcony. The free breakfast buffet was excellent with many choices of breads & pastry, meats, eggs, various fruit, juices etc. Most staff members spoke English fluently with a strong service orientation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but...”
Reviews.Author: asucker
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Cavalletto & Doge Orseolo, Venice is one of the best located hotels for a short visit to Venice. We were here for only three nights as part of a three week train tour trip around Italy (and the Orient Express back). The hotel is best described as 'faded grandeur' - it has seen better days - the paint and carpets were a bit grubby. Others have commented about the indifferent staff - agreed. Some where delightful but overall you came away feeling that we had 'troubled them' or interrupted their routine in some way. More of an inconvenience than a guest. Which is a real shame as the hotel has the bones for being something quite spectacular. Mind you this hotel is NOT expensive by Venice standards - so I guess you get what you pay for'. Returning to Venice is on our list. I doubt however that we will stay here - rather find a little boutique or swanky / blow the budget hotel - Venice and you deserve that!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, awful bathroom, so-so service”
Reviews.Author: TrnrMom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is also listed under Hotel Cavaleto, Venice. The good: location, small outdoor seating areas where you can watch the gondoliers load passengers. The staff: the men were a little stuffy; Marinella was the only really friendly front desk help. The not so good: noise from the bells (but that's Venice), from the street, from the canal. Internet was slow and difficult; keyboard missing the "e" key which made typing really hard. Had to buy & use 1 hour or lose the time (which we did, and weren't informed that this would happen). The room: a bit on the small size; sloped floor, nice looking decor, but tired looking. The bad: moldy shower curtain (they replaced it on request, but the new one had mold also that showed up when it got wet). Missing tile on the side of the tub. Cracked & chipped grout. Worse: mold on the grout. We requested this be cleaned, but it wasn't really different afterwards. Yes, it is Venice, but one would expect a clean bathroom, especially one with a 3star plus rating and a Best Western besides. Contact me for photos which we will be sending to Best Western. Other stuff: this is a tour group hotel used by Brendan. The breakfast: the usual meat, cheese, cereal, breads, canned juices, coffee, tea selection. Different: slightly more varied fruit selection and mozzarella balls and tomatoes.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Sparktwinkle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastically located just off San Marco Square. And outside of the Gondola docking bays. We booked in Febuary week after Valentines, we just missed the masquerade festival (which we wish we had seen). There was heavy rain and it was also Snowing, thus resulting in the hotel bar being flooded, but this didnt deter us enjoying our holiday (in fact it made it all the more memorable). St Marks Chapel in the snow looks russian - which made some lovely photographs. The hotel - It was brilliant, the staff were very accomodating and extremly polite and helpful. The food was breakfast only for us - which was buffet style and additional extras (for hot meals) We choose the continental with fruits, meats, cereal, toasts and hot/cold drinks. We felt this was sufficient enough til we found somewhere to eat for lunch. The room that we had wasnt at all big and we struggled at times to have space, this room type was double, we wish now that we had upgraded as apparantly the Higher rated rooms were spacious and graced with wonderful views (and even had a chandelier in the room). When you book at the cavaletto - you receive a free complimentory visit to the famous Murano Glass factory ( a must for when in venice). If we were to return to venice - we would go back to cavaletto and book a better room, the hotel was lovely and we have no real complaints. Plenty of places to see and places to eat near by, you wont be disappointed in booking this hotel. Its also very close to all the designer shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you don't like sleeping!”
Reviews.Author: the.kes
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel on the basis of its star rating and location but was starting to regret it after the first night. The room was clean and well presented and there were two windows out onto the canal and a street that divided the two parts of the hotel, the room was on the second floor. As it was hot it was necessary to have the bedroom windows wide open as the air conditioning is not switched on until June!, well Saturday night in St Marks Square is noisy, very noisy. But the option was boil alive or try and sleep through it. Second night a party from Mobil/Exxon were booked in for a party in Venice, well they liked to party until 1am in the bar below our room and apparantly there a number of [-----] employed in the company or so they kept bragging and shouting. I mentioned in the morning to staff about keeping the bar windows shut to keep the noise down but I got the impression that corporate customers are more important than tourists. In the main the staff were courteous with the exception of some of the reception staff who seemed somewhat superior to all. Breakfast in the main was excellent except for the final morning when a large party seemed to have cleared everything out and the staff could not cope and there was a struggle to find anything to eat within 45 minutes of breakfast starting. If you do go, do not take a room overlooking the street as the sound of the door slamming shut into the hotel will drive you to distraction, do not go outside of June to September or else you will be without air conditioning and it is necessary. There is a brilliant balcony area overlooking the gondolier station although you may struggle to get the staff to actually open it up and struggle to get someone to deliver a drink to you once there. I would not stay there again although I will return to Venice as it is a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: RajLeicester
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from the 'Albergo Cavalletto' and I have to say it was one of the best hotels we have stayed in. The location is fantastic, so easy to get to once you arrive at St Marks - just look out for the telephone kiosks at the far end of St Marks. The staff were very helpful and freindly. If, like us, you enjoy a cup of tea after a hard days walking, don't forget to ask for a kettle to be sent up to your room. Our room overlooked the basin and although the gondoliers arrived quite early outside, you can't hear them as long as your windows are shut! We were willing to pay the extra for this hotel because we were celebrating a special occasion and it was definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nancymac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Cavaletto in Venice for 2 nights. The hotel is quite attractive but the staff is not very friendly. Our room was 4' by 7' and the beds were 29 inches wide and very short. There are four rooms of this size so, if you intend to stay there, be sure you have one of the larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “No More Than 2 Star For A Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: alberthernandezlopez
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite good, although was too far from a comon 4 stars hotel in Europe. A part from that, the people at the reception was really arrogant, as well us a bit rude, like if had forgiven us our lives...they did not help with city info at all (they only recomende us to see San Marco square).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KMEMP
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be better - once we figured out how to get there from the water taxi from the airport! Most of the hotel staff were absolutely wonderful - with the exception of the only female desk staff. I took this trip with my cousin so we requested two single beds - when we arrived we were given one queen. We were booked into this hotel for one week so we expected to be able to unpack our suitcases. However, this room had no facilities for storing clothing - no dresser drawers, no closets. When I complained to the front desk person about the lack of "storage" - she did not believe me, was quite nasty until she came up to check the room. We did eventually have our room changed. Fortunately, she was not on duty for the rest of our stay there! The rest of the staff was absolutely wonderful - helpful in making reservations, receommendations, etc. The breakfast room was beautiful, the view outside the windows breath-taking. One caveat - if there is a large tour booked into the hotel, the breakfast room is not large enough and you will have to wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelouge
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. Its in a wonderful location to begin with, literally just steps from San Marco Square (at the far end of the Bascilica) and not hard to find at all (a very short walk from the nearest waterbus stop). The room was good. It was quiet and had a great view of a small square just behind the hotel. Best of all was the beautiful breakfast / dining room which was right next to the edge of the canal. Gondolas would literally just pass by right outside the window. The breakfast spread was also generous by european standards. The staff were friendly and had no problems with left luggage. We would recommend it to those looking for a great and reasonably priced place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: yymca6
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a view and we loved it (it was on 1st floor). Service is really multi-lingual and excellent (a bit rushed at the breakfast room but that was only on one day and it was jam packed). Location is more than excellent (a few steps from San Marco). But most of all we never felt it was noisy like other reviewers said. The room was not that small (we had a Queen size bed) and it was pretty clean. Of cours it is small if you compare it to a Holiday Inn room in USA but that's not what we are looking for in Venice (at least I don't). For any one going to Venice and not wanting to bother with location, I suggest this hotel strongly. And it is close to a lot of restaurants (did not try the one suggested by the hotel though)

Reviews.Title: “couldn't fault the service”
Reviews.Author: redria512
Reviews.Content: Great location...so close to everything. If you're worried about room sizes ask for a room in their new building which is just accross the road - everything was brand new, clean and fresh and a lovely size for a city hotel. The service was what we found outstanding.... we were on honeymoon and the barman arranged a late night gondola ride for us with a bottle of our fave tipple in an ice bucket and organised a table with glasses, nibbles and candlelight. It was magic - you pay for it of course and likewise with the drinks... but that's venice - If you want a cheap holiday its not the right place - if you want magic youre there!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: eddiemercx
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this fantastically located hotel that is situated just 20 yards from San Marco Piazza. Although we have been to Paris and the Maldives as romantic getaways this place also features highly on our romantic list of places to visit. The staff were very friendly and extremely courteous. Our room was lovely and the dÃ©cor was to a good standard. Unfortunately the air conditioning did not work but we really did not suffer too much. There is some noise from the gondoliers late at night due to couples taking moonlight punts! We flew with Ryan Air for the first time at a total return cost of just Â£73, which was brilliant. If you have not flown with this company I would highly recommend them. Stay at this lovely Hotel, You wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: unreal32
Reviews.Content: First of all, a disclaimer: my wife and I did not like Venice that much, but that's not the hotels fault! The hotel was close to St Mark's Square, a major landmark. So if you can get back to St Mark's, you can easily find the hotel again. That's a major plus in Venice, a city that does everything in its power to stop people from finding their way around. Maps are useless there. The hotel was nice. Interesting elevator. Or room was on the top floor (4A) on a corner. The small square below was quiet while we were there. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was average. I enjoyed sitting in the bar balcony area and watching the gondola driver's ply their trade. The gondola taxi stand is right out the back door. The "cons" to this hotel were the cost (it's expensive for what you get) and the view from our room. Perhaps we were too close to St Marks Square - it was too busy outside. It's a tough spot to find - you want to be close to the action, but not too close. We will not be returning to Venice because once is enough. But if we did, I would probably look for somewhere else (cheaper) to stay.

Reviews.Title: “cosy!”
Reviews.Author: LaneC
Reviews.Content: arrived at the hotel pleasantly surprised with the reception area. However, was slightly disappointed to see the size of our room tucked away on the fourth floor. The double bed was more an enlarged single and the room could be likened to an elongated box room. However, both the bedroom and bathroom were clean and the room was cosy. We overlooked the mini square behind the hotel which could get noisy at night and first thing in the morning. Our stay in the hotel was pleasant but probably would want to experience a different hotel if we ever came back to Venice. For the first time though, would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Kiwichik
Reviews.Content: Situated just behind St Marks Piazza with gondolas floating outside the breakfast room. Pleasant helpful staff. Great Continental Buffet Breakfast. Rooms in the New Building were large, clean and bright. Nice Bar attached to the hotel but didn't seem to keep regular hours.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, small rooms but great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the location but had to complain to the management about the noise every morning when the breakfast trolleys were wheeled along the street adjacent at 6:30 waking us up. The room was very small and not particulary clean. The staff were friendly except the Bar Manager. We would not use this hotel again. I would rather pay a little more money for a better hotel even if it was further away from St Marks.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely coming back again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just got back after 4 nights at the Cavalletto. It is in the best location as it takes only moments to reach St Marks Square. We found our room very pretty with a view over the rooftops - the location of which was the only downside as we had to climb several flights of stairs. Well soundproofed as it needed to be with the festivities of Carnival going on outside! Clean sheets and towels every day. The staff were very pleasant and helpful in all areas and the poor porters earned their wages with the many stairs to climb with suitcases etc. Breakfast was very good with plenty of choice to suit most tastes - we found we didn't need to eat much at lunchtime. The bar, which we only went in once, was comfortably furnished but a bit pricey. We would definitely stay here again as we didn't see a better hotel within our price range anywhere else in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location”
Reviews.Author: MikeP2K
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to Venice today. We stayed for 2 nights at the Cavalletto. The hotel is literally a 30 second walk to Saint Marks square. The higher end shops (Louis Vuitton etc) are also only a 1 minute walk from the hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I read previous comments that the hotel's service was not good since it was franchised with Best Western. I completely disagree with that statement. The front desk was extremely helpful upon checkout and making giving us directions to different clubs and bars whenever we asked. The only negative thing I can say about this hotel is that it's a bit expensive if you get a canal view. The canal view is only of a small bit just in front of the hotel. So those of you who are thinking it will be romantic to look out onto the Grand Canal while in your room, think again. Other than that it was a great stay and I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “a stones throw from St Marks Sq”
Reviews.Author: Aliantracy
Reviews.Content: Arrived not knowing that this hotel is now owned by the chain 'best western'. Room on the 4th floor tiny and not suitable for more than one night. Although pleasant balcony, only with view of rooftops and canal below. The room may have been quaint in its time when owned by italians who lent a bit of authenticity to its old and small feel. But now the staff were curt, unhelpful, and frankly uninterested. The breakfast was bland although unending. The real plus though is the location... you couldn't get much closer to St Marks unless you set up camp in the centre of the square. I suppose the price was to be expected in the middle of such a tourist location, but would've only really been justified had the hotel added to the magical feeling as opposed to almost detracting from it!

Reviews.Title: “Return trip”
Reviews.Author: mackfrance
Reviews.Content: This was a return trip after seven years. If you want to stay in a good hotel at a realistic prices and in a great location just off St Marks Square, the Cavalletto is good but not excellent. The rooms are not large but have all that you want. Staff were welcoming and efficient. On the down side some parts of the building are looking a bit tired and i thought that the serve yourself buffet went a bit too far with the coffee being available from a communal thermos.

Reviews.Title: “Had no choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying here for 3 night because the other hotel had given away our room. This was suppose to be a second honeymoon. We were given a room up on the 4th floor in a corner. We ended up with 2 single beds. The shower was to small for my husband. We had to move the night stand and put the other bed next to the other bed. It barely fit because of the stairs that led to a window. No view. Just a window. The one thing was that it had plenty of hot water for showers. There was no soundproofing. You could here everything going on outside. The breakfast was nice. Because we had problems with the front desk on checkout, we missed the flights and had to stay an extra day in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: t_woman
Reviews.Content: Great location! Located a block from San Marco Square. Water-taxis can come right to the hotel door (which I highly recommend, otherwise you will navigate your own luggage over the cobbled streets of Venice from the main taxi area). Front-desk staff very accommodating, helpful, speak English. (We had to make a few changes in our reservations and they responded via emails promptly.) Rooms spacious, nice bathroom. Very good breakfast (meats, cheese, cereals, breads, egg, fruit). Bar in hotel. Only drawback is elevator only goes to 2nd floor, then you must walk to the upper floors 3-5, although it was great exercise! They do have bellboys to take your luggage. A bit pricey, but well worth it! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: Nepwardle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location to all of Venice's wonderful sights. The rooms are slightly smaller than average and it does flood twice a day due to the lagoons high tides, but this adds to the romance of staying in such a wonderful city. A tip to any travel agent or booker that is looking at this hotel, please tell the traveller about the high tides. I am a fairly slight female who like any other female out there always packs to much. I did my research on the city like any other traveller but did not find out that my hotel floods and I am unable to reach it by normal means, from this I had to haul my heavy case over several large bridges. But apart from that it is a good hotel with great service.
